page.title: 18THE COUNTRYSIDE AROUND SANDY
page.content: TO THE EAST OF SANDY THE LAND RISES TO AN AREA KNOWN AS THE PINNACLE. THE PINNACLE, COMMONLY KNOWN AS THE SANDHILLS BECAUSE OF THE SANDY SOIL, IS A FAVOURITE RECREATION AREA. FROM THE TOP OF THE PINNACLE YOU ARE ABLE TO OVERLOOK SANDY AND YOU REALISE THE SIZE OF IT WITH THE RAILWAY RUNNING MORE OR LESS PARALLEL TO THE A1. THE WOODLAND AROUND THIS AREA CONSISTS MOSTLY OF DECIDUOUS TREES, OAK, ASH, HORSE CHESTNUT ETC, ALTHOUGH THERE ARE SOME CONIFERS. BEYOND THE PINNACLE TRAVELLING TOWARDS THE VILLAGE OF EVERTON THE WOODLANDS ARE PRIVATE PROPERTY. HAZELLS HALL AND FARM ARE THE PROPERTY OF FRANCIS PYM M.P. HOWEVER, THE FAMILY DO NOT RESIDE AT THE HALL BUT AT THE NEARBY EVERTON PARK. HAZELLS HALL HAS RECENTLY BEEN CONVERTED INTO FLATS.
